sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Flavor Flav, MGM Resorts set party for Olympians
feed.summary: Rapper Flavor Flav and MGM Resorts International are partnering to host a "She Got Game" event for U.S. Winter Olympic athletes in Las Vegas from July 16-19. The event targets all U.S. female medal-winners, the U.S. bobsled and skeleton team from the Milan Games, and Paralympic athletes. This collaboration comes after Flavor Flav's initial offer to host female medalists received widespread support from Las Vegas resorts and officials.

feed.title: Lowe’s Companies Inc (NYSE:LOW) Profit Falls
feed.summary: Lowe's Companies Inc (NYSE:LOW) saw its profit fall in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2025, with net earnings of $1.0 billion and diluted EPS of $1.78, down from the previous year. Despite beating analyst estimates for adjusted EPS and revenue in Q4, the company issued a conservative outlook for 2026, anticipating total sales between $92 billion and $94 billion and adjusted EPS of $12.25 to $12.75, which is below analyst expectations due to a pressured housing market.

feed.title: Jefferies Sees Credit Karma Driving Potential Upside for Intuit Inc. (INTU)
feed.summary: Jefferies has reiterated a Buy rating on Intuit Inc. (INTU) while lowering its price target to $650, anticipating strong fiscal Q2 results despite a short tax e-filing period and seeing potential upside from Credit Karma. Intuit also recently launched the TurboTax "Done-For-You" experience, a hybrid model combining Agentic AI with expert support to streamline tax preparation. Although Intuit is considered a strong investment, some AI stocks may offer greater upside potential with less risk.

feed.title: Flutter Entertainment (NYSE:FLUT) Price Target Cut to $210.00 by Analysts at Oppenheimer
feed.summary: Oppenheimer has lowered its price target for Flutter Entertainment (NYSE:FLUT) from $280.00 to $210.00, while maintaining an "outperform" rating, indicating a potential 74% upside. Several other analysts have also revised their targets downwards, though the overall consensus remains a "Moderate Buy" with an average target of $265.60. Shares are currently trading around $120.65, near their 1-year low, reflecting recent market weakness and valuation concerns.

feed.title: Delta Air Lines Aims at Fleet Growth: More Upside Ahead?
feed.summary: Delta Air Lines is expanding its widebody fleet with new Airbus and Boeing aircraft to meet increasing air-travel demand and strengthen its global network. The fleet modernization efforts, including partnerships with GE Aerospace, aim to boost premium seating, improve fuel efficiency, and support international expansion into key long-haul destinations. While Delta's shares have outperformed its industry, its valuation is higher than industrial levels, and analysts have recently increased earnings estimates for 2026 and 2027.

feed.title: Gartner: How Agentic AI is Reshaping Supply Chain Roles
feed.summary: New research from Gartner indicates that agentic AI is significantly altering entry-level supply chain roles and talent strategies. While many leaders anticipate a reduction in entry-level positions and overall workforce headcount due to AI, high-performing organizations are focusing on talent reinvention, upskilling employees to work with AI, and optimizing workforce planning rather than solely cutting jobs. The report emphasizes redesigning roles and processes so that humans and AI can collaborate effectively to create value.

feed.title: Jefferies & Co Adjusts Agilent Technologies Price Target to $135 From $150, Maintains Hold Rating
feed.summary: Jefferies & Co has reduced its price target for Agilent Technologies (A) to $135 from $150, while reiterating a "Hold" rating on the stock. This adjustment reflects a moderated outlook for the company. Other firms like TD Cowen, Wells Fargo, Barclays, Baird, and UBS also adjusted their price targets for Agilent, mostly maintaining positive ratings but with lowered expectations.

feed.title: Is Bristol Myers Squibb (BMY) Pricing In Its 2024 Results And Product Pipeline Outlook?
feed.summary: This article analyzes Bristol-Myers Squibb's (BMY) valuation based on its 2024 results, product pipeline, and future outlook. Using Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) and Price-to-Earnings (P/E) ratio analyses, Simply Wall St suggests BMY is currently undervalued. The article also presents bull and bear case narratives to offer different perspectives on the company's fair value.

feed.title: ServiceNow Launches Autonomous Workforce That Think and Acts; Adds Moveworks to the ServiceNow AI Platform
feed.summary: ServiceNow has introduced its Autonomous Workforce, a system of AI specialists capable of executing enterprise-level tasks with governance and authority, freeing human employees for more strategic work. The company also rolled out ServiceNow EmployeeWorks, combining Moveworks' conversational AI and search with ServiceNow's platform to streamline employee requests. This initiative aims to provide deterministic outcomes for businesses by integrating probabilistic AI with established workflows, ensuring security, auditability, and operational consistency.

feed.title: A Look At Eversource Energy’s Valuation As Winter Storm Outages Put Grid Resilience In Focus
feed.summary: A recent winter storm in the northeastern U.S. has led to significant outages for Eversource Energy (ES) customers, highlighting grid resilience issues. Despite operational risks, Eversource has seen an eventful start to 2026 with updated earnings guidance and a US$750 million bond offering, resulting in a 12.32% share price return over the past 90 days. The company's valuation is currently near analyst price targets and intrinsic value estimates, suggesting it is fairly valued, driven by anticipated electricity demand, infrastructure investments, and steady revenue growth.

feed.title: Did Thermo Fisher’s (TMO) 10% Dividend Hike After Earnings Beat Just Reframe Its Capital Return Story?
feed.summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific recently increased its quarterly cash dividend by 10% to US$0.47 per share, payable on April 15, 2026. This hike follows a strong fourth-quarter earnings beat and stable 2026 growth guidance, signaling management's confidence in the company's cash generation capabilities, alongside strategic investments such as a new data collaboration with Datavant. The dividend increase supports the company's investment narrative, balancing reinvestment for long-term growth with cash returns to shareholders, without significantly altering its risk profile.

feed.title: Fluor Refocuses Risk With NuScale Exit And Contract Shift
feed.summary: Fluor (NYSE:FLR) is reducing its business risk by selling its majority stake in NuScale Power and moving away from fixed-price contracts. These strategic shifts aim to adjust Fluor's exposure to nuclear energy and manage project risk more effectively. Investors should monitor how these changes impact the stability of Fluor's earnings and its project portfolio.

feed.title: eBay announces workforce reduction amid business restructuring
feed.summary: eBay Inc. announced it will cut approximately 6% of its global workforce, or about 800 employees, as part of a restructuring effort to reduce costs and realign operations. This is the third round of layoffs for the company in three years, with management citing rising costs and headcount growth outpacing the business as reasons for the reduction. Despite the news, eBay's shares traded higher, adding 3.4% and showing a 27% increase over the last 12 months.

feed.title: Air Liquide and Sasol sign long-term contracts to supply an additional 110 MW of renewable energy to the Secunda site
feed.summary: Air Liquide and Sasol have signed new Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) with Enel Green Power RSA for an additional 110 MW of renewable power for Sasol's Secunda site in South Africa. This marks the fourth set of PPAs, bringing the total renewable capacity to approximately 690 MW. The initiative aims to reduce Air Liquide's CO2 emissions by about 1.2 million tonnes annually, contributing to a 30% to 40% reduction in CO2 from oxygen production at Secunda by 2031, with a new wind farm expected to be operational by 2026.

feed.title: 10 Financials Stocks Whale Activity In Today's Session
feed.summary: This article details "whale activity" in the financials sector, specifically analyzing unusual options trading for ten different stocks including Aflac, American Express, and SoFi Technologies. It explains various option alerts, their terminology, and provides a breakdown of specific call and put option trades with their associated sentiments, expiration dates, strike prices, and total trade costs. The goal is to help traders identify potential opportunities based on significant institutional options movements.

feed.title: Textron Systems’ Damocles loitering munition selected for U.S. Army LASSO prototype contract
feed.summary: Textron Systems has secured a prototype agreement with the U.S. Army for its Damocles loitering munition system under the Low Altitude Stalking & Strike Ordnance (LASSO) program. The Damocles system, featuring a GEN2 Explosively Formed Penetrator and VTOL capability, is designed for lethal effects in peer warfare, beyond-line-of-sight operations, and offers a modular open systems approach for payload integration. This selection underscores the growing importance of loitering munition technology in modern battlefield protection.

feed.title: 10 Health Care Stocks Whale Activity In Today's Session
feed.summary: This article details "whale" options trading activity across ten health care stocks, including Edwards Lifesciences (NYSE:EW) and Hims & Hers Health (NYSE:HIMS). It provides specific examples of bullish, bearish, and neutral put and call option sweeps and trades, highlighting the strike prices, expiration dates, and total trade values. The piece aims to help traders identify potential opportunities by tracking significant institutional transactions.

feed.title: Agilent Technologies (A): Wells Fargo Lowers Price Target to $16
feed.summary: Wells Fargo analyst Brandon Couillard has lowered the price target for Agilent Technologies (A) from $175.00 to $165.00, while maintaining an "Overweight" rating. This adjustment reflects a 5.71% decrease in the target. Despite the lowered target, the average target price from 19 analysts is $166.28, implying a 42.67% upside from its current price of $116.55.

feed.title: Humana Inc (HUM) Trading 3.08% Higher on Feb 26
feed.summary: Humana Inc (HUM) shares rose 3.08% in mid-day trading on February 26th, reaching an intraday high of $183.38 and closing at $181.49. This puts HUM 42.45% below its 52-week high and 7.00% above its 52-week low. Analysts have an average target price of $230.29 for HUM, implying a 26.89% upside, while GuruFocus estimates a GF Value of $544.54, suggesting a 200.04% upside.

feed.title: Super Micro Computer falls 6% as AI-hardware sentiment weakens and margin concerns linger
feed.summary: Super Micro Computer (SMCI) stock dropped 6.0% due to weakening sentiment in the AI-hardware sector and ongoing investor concerns about compressed gross margins. Despite strong recent revenue, profit-taking is occurring as the market shifts focus from revenue growth to profitability and execution risks. This decline is part of a broader risk-off movement affecting AI-linked hardware stocks.

feed.title: Fidelis Insurance Group to Rebrand as Pelagos Insurance Capital in 2026
feed.summary: Fidelis Insurance Holdings Ltd., a Bermuda-based specialty insurer and reinsurer, announced its intention to change its name to Pelagos Insurance Capital Ltd. The rebranding is expected to take effect in May 2026, when the company will also begin trading under the new NYSE ticker symbol, PLGO. Group CEO Dan Burrows explained that "Pelagos," derived from "archipelago," reflects the company's identity as strategic capital allocators and its global community of connected teams and partners.

feed.title: Sandbrook sells Comfort Systems USA (FIX) shares for $3.6m
feed.summary: William J. Sandbrook, a director at Comfort Systems USA (NYSE:FIX), sold 2,500 shares of common stock for $3.61 million on February 24, 2026. This transaction occurred as FIX stock is trading near its 52-week high, having delivered a 288% return over the past year. Despite recent strong financial results for Q4 2025, InvestingPro analysis suggests the stock may be overvalued.

feed.title: POSCO INTERNATIONAL and POSCO FUTURE M Collaborate to Achieve Carbon Neutrality Through Rooftop Solar Project
feed.summary: POSCO INTERNATIONAL and POSCO FUTURE M are collaborating on a rooftop solar project at POSCO FUTURE M’s Gwangyang Cathode Plant to achieve carbon neutrality and meet RE100 goals for battery materials. This initiative, which includes installing 2.2MW of solar panels to generate 2.6GWh of renewable energy annually, marks the first joint renewable energy project between the two companies. It demonstrates synergy within the POSCO Group and sets a precedent for future renewable energy expansions, including at plants in Pohang.

feed.title: Vistra’s 2026 Guidance Reinforces Its Multi-Year Growth Path
feed.summary: Vistra (VST) recorded a strong performance in 2025 with $5.91 billion in Adjusted EBITDA, exceeding its guidance despite significant hedging losses. The company's 2026 Adjusted EBITDA guidance is set between $6.8 billion and $7.6 billion, indicating substantial growth. Vistra has also secured long-term power purchase agreements with AWS and Meta, anchoring its nuclear portfolio while actively managing capital through share buybacks.

feed.title: F5 Labs Sets New Standard for AI Security Benchmarking with Model Risk Leaderboards and Threat Intelligence
feed.summary: F5, Inc. has launched new threat intelligence resources through F5 Labs, including the Comprehensive AI Security Index (CASI) and Agentic Resistance Score (ARS) leaderboards. These tools provide standardized, monthly-updated benchmarks for enterprise security leaders to measure and compare the risk profiles of popular AI models based on real-time attack intelligence and analysis of evolving AI attack vectors. The initiative aims to help organizations evaluate and select AI models prior to production and enhance their defenses against application security threats.

feed.title: Walmart to Pay $100 Million to Settle FTC Allegations Over Deceptive Practices for Delivery Drivers
feed.summary: Walmart Inc. has agreed to pay $100 million to settle allegations from the U.S. Federal Trade Commission that the company deceived delivery drivers in its Spark program about their potential earnings, including base pay, incentive pay, and tips. The FTC, joined by 11 states, alleges that Walmart also falsely claimed all customer tips would go to drivers. As part of the settlement, Walmart will implement an earnings verification program and has stated it has already begun making payments to affected drivers.

feed.title: Rakuten Symphony and Kyivstar Sign Letter of Intent to Deploy Open RAN to Rebuild Ukraine’s Digital Infrastructure
feed.summary: Rakuten Symphony and Kyivstar have signed a Letter of Intent to deploy Open Radio Access Network (Open RAN) technology for rebuilding Ukraine's digital infrastructure. This collaboration, which includes 4G and 5G Open RAN, is part of VEON's $600 million investment commitment to Ukraine's reconstruction. The initiative underscores both companies' dedication to supporting Ukraine's recovery and its digital future.

feed.title: Wrangler launches NFC-tagged archival pieces and connected content hub
feed.summary: Wrangler has launched a collection of vintage clothing featuring NFC tags that provide traceability and access to exclusive brand content, developed in collaboration with vintage clothing brand MNTGE. The initiative, announced by Global Creative and Concept Director Sean Gormley, aims to enrich the customer experience by sharing the brand's history and product insights, and will be expanded to Wrangler's "Reborn" archive program. This move is part of Wrangler's broader engagement with web3 technology, including previous NFT auctions and plans for more, while its parent company Kontoor Brands, Inc. recently reported an 8% increase in Q3 revenue.

feed.title: THERMO FISHER SCIENTIFIC INC. SEC 10-K Report
feed.summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. has released its 2025 Form 10-K report, highlighting a 4% increase in total revenues to $44,556 million and a 7% rise in diluted EPS to $17.74. The report details robust performance across its four key business segments, strategic acquisitions to enhance proteomics and bioproduction capabilities, and ongoing investments in innovation and global expansion. The company also addresses challenges and risks including market competition, economic volatility, and regulatory pressures.

feed.title: POOL CORP SEC 10-K Report
feed.summary: POOL CORP, the world's largest wholesale distributor of swimming pool supplies, equipment, and related leisure products, has released its 2025 10-K report detailing its financial performance, business operations, and strategic initiatives. The company reported net sales consistent with the previous year but saw a decrease in operating and net income due to increased expenses and the absence of a prior-year tax benefit. POOL CORP plans to expand its geographic presence, invest in technology, and manage discretionary spending while navigating intense competition, macroeconomic risks, and supply chain challenges.

feed.title: Genpact LTD SEC 10-K Report
feed.summary: Genpact LTD has released its annual Form 10-K report, detailing financial performance, business operations, and strategic initiatives. The report highlights the company's focus on Advanced Technology Solutions, including AI and digital transformation, and its efforts in capital management. Key challenges include intense competition in AI, evolving regulatory landscapes, and the need to attract and retain skilled talent.

feed.title: Medtech M&A starts off strong in 2026
feed.summary: The medical device merger and acquisition (M&A) market has seen a strong start in 2026, building on activity from the previous year. Boston Scientific's planned $14.5 billion acquisition of Penumbra leads the deals, alongside other significant purchases by companies like Danaher and Medtronic. Several major divestitures by large medtech firms are also in progress, indicating a dynamic landscape of strategic repositioning within the industry.

feed.title: ViVE 2024: Humana taps data automation startup Veda to polish up provider directories
feed.summary: Humana has partnered with data automation company Veda to enhance the accuracy of its provider directories, aiming to improve patient access to care and reduce administrative burdens. The collaboration leverages Veda's AI platform to analyze, verify, and standardize Humana's provider data, cutting down turnaround times significantly. This initiative addresses the persistent issue of inaccurate provider information, which has been highlighted by various studies and regulatory requirements like the No Surprises Act.

feed.title: Honeywell Hits Aerospace Company With Patent Suit Over Software
feed.summary: Honeywell International Inc. has filed a patent infringement lawsuit against Lone Star Aerospace Inc., alleging that Lone Star's MaxUp software products, which provide operational analytics for aircraft, infringe five of Honeywell's patents. The complaint, filed in a Texas federal court, claims that Lone Star's software uses methods similar to Honeywell's patented technologies for monitoring aircraft maintenance and productivity.

feed.title: Public Service Enterprise Group Incorporated Reports Earnings Results for the Full Year Ended December 31, 2025
feed.summary: Public Service Enterprise Group Incorporated (PSEG) reported strong financial results for the full year ended December 31, 2025. The company's sales increased to USD 12,168 million from USD 10,290 million the previous year, while net income rose to USD 2,111 million from USD 1,772 million. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations also saw a significant increase to USD 4.22 from USD 3.54.

feed.title: John Deere plans new SmartDetect Assist for ConExpo
feed.summary: John Deere is set to unveil SmartDetect Assist at ConExpo 2026, a new object-detection technology that automatically slows and stops machinery when it detects a human or object. This system enhances safety by providing operators with high-resolution camera and radar views of surroundings, alongside projected reverse path lines for improved situational awareness. Deere and Wirtgen will showcase 24 machines across two exhibit spaces at the upcoming event.

feed.title: Gilat report "very strong 2023"
feed.summary: Gilat Satellite Networks reported "very strong" financial results for Q4 and the full year 2023, with full-year revenue up 11% to $266.1 million and Adjusted EBITDA increasing by 44% to $36.4 million. The company attributes this success to its business model, strategic acquisitions like DataPath, and significant contract wins in cellular backhaul and in-flight connectivity. Gilat also provided optimistic 2024 guidance, projecting continued strong growth in revenue and profit.

feed.title: Meta class action alleges $500M stock pump-and-dump scheme using scam ads
feed.summary: A class action lawsuit has been filed against Meta Platforms Inc., alleging that the company facilitated a $500 million stock pump-and-dump scheme through scam ads on its Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp platforms. Plaintiffs claim Meta's advertising tools were exploited to promote a fraudulent investment in Jayud Global Logistics Ltd. (JYD), leading to significant losses for victims. The lawsuit accuses Meta of knowingly ignoring these scam ads, which generated advertising revenue, and seeks damages and a court order for Meta to implement better ad monitoring procedures.

feed.title: Boeing lifts Africa aircraft demand forecast by 40% on strong economic growth (BA:NYSE)
feed.summary: Boeing has substantially increased its long-term aircraft demand forecast for Africa by 40%, now projecting a need for around 1,700 new aircraft. This revision is attributed to the continent's accelerating economic growth and the corresponding rise in air travel. The company anticipates strong growth in the African aviation sector.

feed.title: Sysco Strengthens Market Position Through Strategic Coffee Chain Alliance
feed.summary: Sysco has entered a strategic partnership with Reborn Coffee, leveraging its supply chain network to support the coffee chain's national expansion. This alliance solidifies Sysco's market leadership in foodservice logistics, especially in the specialty beverages segment, and follows a strong Q2 2026 financial performance with raised EPS guidance. The partnership is expected to drive further efficiency and growth for Sysco while ensuring consistent product standards for Reborn Coffee.

feed.title: Work Underway to Upgrade Electric System in Western Pennsylvania
feed.summary: FirstEnergy Pennsylvania Electric Company (FE PA) is upgrading its electric system in Western Pennsylvania by installing automated reclosing devices and electronic controllers in substations across Clarion, Washington, and Westmoreland counties. This $147 million initiative is part of FE PA's Long Term Infrastructure Improvement Plan II and aims to enhance service reliability for over 26,000 customers, particularly during adverse weather conditions, by preventing lengthy power outages and speeding up restoration times. The new equipment, already partially in service and expected to be fully operational by mid-year, will prevent and isolate outages more efficiently.

feed.title: Yum Brands CEO Turner sells $40k in stock By Investing.com
feed.summary: Yum Brands CEO Christopher Lee Turner recently sold 242 shares of company stock for $40,176, with the shares trading near their 52-week high. An InvestingPro analysis indicates the stock is currently overvalued. This insider transaction follows a mixed Q4 2025 earnings report where the company beat revenue expectations but missed on EPS.

feed.title: Verisk Analytics Issues $1 Billion in Senior Notes
feed.summary: Verisk Analytics has issued $1 billion in new senior notes due in 2031 and 2036 to refinance short-term bank debt and bolster capital management. The company plans to use the net proceeds to repay outstanding term loans and revolving credit facility draws, along with funding for accelerated share repurchase agreements. This strategic financial move aims to reduce liquidity risk and signal disciplined capital management to investors.

feed.title: Sempra Energy's Q4 Earnings Top Estimates, Revenues Fall Y/Y
feed.summary: Sempra Energy (SRE) reported adjusted earnings of $1.28 per share for the fourth quarter of 2025, surpassing the Zacks Consensus Estimate, despite a 14.7% decrease from the prior year. Total revenues also beat estimates at $3.75 billion, though they saw a slight year-over-year decline. The company provided optimistic EPS guidance for 2026, 2027, and 2030, and currently holds a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).

feed.title: US Secretary of Energy Chris Wright to Address CERAWeek by S&P Global in Houston, March 23-27
feed.summary: U.S. Secretary of Energy Chris Wright is scheduled to deliver a plenary address at the 44th annual CERAWeek by S&P Global in Houston from March 23-27, 2026. The conference, focusing on "Convergence and Competition: Energy, Technology and Geopolitics," will bring together global energy leaders, government officials, and experts to discuss critical issues shaping American national and energy security and the evolving global energy landscape. Key themes will include politics, economics, trade, supply chains, AI, digital, and investment in the transforming energy system.

feed.title: Fermi Inc. (FRMI) Shareholders Who Lost Money Have Opportunity to Lead Securities Fraud Lawsuit
feed.summary: The Law Offices of Frank R. Cruz announced an opportunity for Fermi Inc. (FRMI) investors who suffered losses to lead a securities fraud class action lawsuit. The lawsuit alleges that Fermi Inc. made materially misleading statements between October 1, 2025, and December 11, 2025, concerning its "Project Matador" campus, specifically regarding tenant demand, reliance on a single tenant's funding, and the risk of that funding being terminated. Investors are encouraged to participate before the lead plaintiff deadline on March 6, 2026.

feed.title: First SEC-registered blockchain stock opens to retail investors on moomoo
feed.summary: Moomoo served as the first U.S. brokerage platform to provide retail investors access to Figure Technology Solutions Inc.’s blockchain-native share offering (FGRD) on February 26, 2026. This offering represents the first SEC-registered public equity issued in blockchain-native form. Moomoo facilitated participation through existing brokerage accounts with U.S. dollar buying power, charging no commissions on U.S.-listed equities and no blockchain "gas" fees for FGRD subscriptions or trading.

feed.title: Steris Stock Near Record Highs: Safe Haven Play or Priced for Perfection?
feed.summary: Steris plc (STE) has significantly outperformed the S&P 500, driven by stable hospital demand and essential infection-prevention solutions. While the stock offers defensive qualities and predictable growth, its current premium valuation poses a key risk to future returns. Investors should weigh its stability and consistent performance against its elevated price, considering it more as a steady compounder for portfolio anchoring than a high-growth opportunity.

feed.title: PTA-PVR: BAWAG Group AG: Release according to article 135 section 2 BörseG
feed.summary: BlackRock, Inc. has notified BAWAG Group AG of a change in its major holdings, crossing a threshold on February 23, 2026. The notification indicates a slight decrease in BlackRock's total voting rights in BAWAG Group AG from 5.52% to 5.42%. This includes both direct voting rights attached to shares and voting rights through financial instruments.

feed.title: Dollar Tree Customer Drops Suit Over ‘Deceptive’ Cookie Banner
feed.summary: A Dollar Tree Stores Inc. customer has voluntarily dismissed a proposed class action lawsuit against the retailer. The lawsuit alleged that Dollar Tree continued to collect website visitors' data even after they rejected tracking tools via a cookie consent banner. The dismissal comes four months after a magistrate judge denied Dollar Tree's motion to dismiss claims of invasion of privacy and violations of California law.
